subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Box alternatives.
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-268822724-1204300124=:46234
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

I actually have a theory on this, but this is ONLY MY THEORY, based solely on conventional EVP research I have done in the past.
   
  When you make sound, your breath passes through the vocal cords in your voice box and causes them to vibrate.  Hence the key word here "Vibration".  Given the audio we pick up via conventional EVP I believe they need our Vibrations to project their speech to imprint on to the recording.  That is why many times they will talk over you or are in the back ground during your conversations.  I believe you can capture this audio anywhere (NOT just in haunted locations).  Many of us choose to do our communication from our home, work, etc. and have no problem obtaining such audio.  So for those who believe you can only get EVP from a haunted location, I say Bologna!
   
  I believe (and remember this is only my theory) that is why anything that projects a constant sound, movement of pattern, (white noise, the radio scanning) you are allowing that opportunity to capture that audio.  
   
  As far as the box research end, when skeptics imply that its merely radio fragments, I have to disagree totally.  The believe that the scanning of these stations are allowing the projection of these voices to come through.  Many times if you notice the audio falls between the scanning (noted with the ticking of the 469).  Also on many occasions the pitch of the actual true EVP is very different to the voices heard on the radio.  Its as if hitching a ride to formulate the audio and/or words.  Frank and many others do not speak while conducting a session, BUT the noise that is being project from the devises used as well as the actually scanning compensates for our audio or works via the same way as our speech.
   
  Another scenario I will through into the mix is the fact that not all mammals have vocal cords, such as whales.  Whales make rhythmic, repeated patterns of sounds, or songs.The lowest sounds in their songs are audible over long distances. They direct a beam of click-like sounds and listen to the echoes that return from objects in the path of the sound. They are able to detect food and other animals this way as well. This  may be ways of sending sounds intended  as communication at short range through the water.  
   
  So is this any difference through space (or the air) vs the water?  Hell if I know, but just why could this be on the same premise?
   
  Just my thoughts!
   
  Juli
  

  

lisbyfarrum <lisby@...> wrote:
          You know what a doofus I am when it comes to electronics and basic
radio understanding, but I experience exactly what you mention here,
LC. I also find that as soon as I speak, they start shouting through
the box--almost as if they need the energy of my voice, too. I'm
always starting a question and stopping because they're suddenly
coming through so loudly. Of course, when I stop, so do they... :(

Ann

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "LC Duplatt" <lcdupla@...> wrote:
>
> Regarding the "noisy" box, why do EVPs seem to come through during 
> people talking? I have noticed that I find more EVPs if I or another 
> is talking, and then the voice seems to appear between and/or with 
> the audio voices. Carrier, perhaps?
> 
> LC
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@> wrote:
> >
> > Hey mister this is the kind of post I like! I've been apprehensive
> > about blogging here because if you don't regularly upload your audio
> > files it results in being ostracized by a lot of participants here.
> > And the fighting amongst some people is discouraging also. But I
> > prefer video as you and some others know. So I quietly videotape
> > sessions and share them with other researchers who aren't anxious to
> > pounce on anyone based on opinion or frequency of posting here.
> > 
> > Suffice to say virtually every method of ITC is employed by me, and
> > call me obsolete if you want to but I still mainly use RVG maybe
> > because it's what I have to work with even though most others 
> embrace
> > sweep. I've got Hacked Shack and other commercial Boxes, but always
> > end up going to an early style Box with RVG only. It's noisy, and
> > single mode, but it's what I use most often anyway because of the 
> results.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@>
> > wrote:
> > >
> > > 
> > > Hi all; There are alternatives; 1-EVPmaker, a free program that
> > runs on a PC and performs the same function as the box, that is it
> > provides the raw audio spirits/entities use to form voices. It is in
> > fact the inspiration for my boxes. 2-The Mini box by
> > paranormalsystems.com. It's a direct output, linear sweep system 
> based
> > on my boxes, and it does work. 3-Use the manual sweep mathod, take 
> a
> > radio that can be tuned easily by hand, tune the dial up and down
> > slowly while recording directly from the speaker. Always announce 
> you
> > are doing an EVP session before you start recording. Manual sweep 
> was
> > the basis for linear sweep that the Mini box uses, and that I have
> > adopted for my boxes, and was first developed here on this group. 
> 3-
> > Foreign language-Tune in a short wave broadcast in a language you
> > don't understand, and record directly from the speaker of the radio.
> > You can also use an internet foreign language boroadcast for the 
> same
> > purpose. See coffeepotghost.com for more information. 4-Radio 
> between
> > stations as a source of white noise. I like to pick a night when 
> there
> > lots of skip, stations fadding in and oput randomly, this is a great
> > source of raw audio. You'll have ignore the critics that cliam 
> you're
> > only hearing broadcast fragments, you hav eto judge the result by
> > meaning, that is, does the message mean anything personally? I'm
> > sure there's other methods out on the web. I suggest peole start 
> wiht
> > white noise, and work your way up. 
> > > 
> > > There is nothing magical about the boxes, it's a swept radio,
> > nothing more. It provides a higher level--louder--audio that spirits
> > use to make voices, that is all it does! I usually do not ask
> > questions when I do sessions, I think that biases the mind into
> > expecting, and maybe even creating the answers one wants the hear. I
> > rely on the guides to give me what I need. I also don't do
> > "investigations", again I think it biases your mind into creating 
> what
> > you want. I really doubt there is any haunting if no one is there to
> > experience it. I know---what I say is to be dismissed as it 
> doesn't
> > jive with the Hollywood version of the paranormal. Frank-S 
> > > __________________________________________________________
> > > Connect and share in new ways with Windows Live.
> > >
> > http://www.windowslive.com/share.html?
> ocid=TXT_TAGHM_Wave2_sharelife_012008
> > >
> >
>
